column4: could you pastebin the result of "sudo -l", and "sudo -ll <whichever command you wanted to run>"?

well, there's your problem. what sort of program is this? what's the output of the "file" command on the executable?

It's Xilinx - A program for FPGAs. the command i run is gksudo ise - Which I know is the right executable because I can launch it just fine without sudo but it doesn't function properly unless it has sudo.
There is no file command. It's GUI program.
and when you run it via sudo, it drops out without prompting for a password?
it says it cannot find it when I use sudo: sudo: ise: command not found
or simply provide the full path to the executable, if you prefer.
Yeah I forgot that part. It launched but without prompting me for password. Can you force it to prompt the password?
you can try "sudo -K" to remove the timestamp, then try again.
another thing to try: get a root shell via "sudo -i", and then try running the executable directly.
Well it seems to work alright with the sudo now, but it still cannot launch external applications. But I think I'll take a look at their website.
So I thank you for your assistance.
no trouble, best of luck getting things working properly.
